articles.title: Electronic Health Records Phenotyping
articles.contents:
Welcome
This website contains materials for Biostatistics Workshop in 2022 SSC Annual Meeting Online.
In this workshop, we will introduce statistical learning methods designed to expedite the phenotyping process in order to improve the scalability of EHR research.
Module 1 Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and Feature Selection (Exerciese 1)
Module 2 Model Fitting and Evaluation (Exerciese 2)
PheCAP
We will use the real EHR data examples from PheCAP, an R package that implements high-throughput phenotyping with electronic health record (EHR) using a common automated pipeline..
Required packages
Here is a list of packages that will be used during the workshop.


# From CRAN
install.packages("PheCAP")
install.packages("PheNorm")
install.packages("MAP")

install.packages("tidyverse")

install.packages("glmnet")
install.packages("randomForestSRC")
install.packages("pROC")



Resources
Publicly available EHR dataset
Physionet
n2n2 competitions

NLP software
cTAKES
clinspacy
medspacy

Acknowledgments
This website was made with the distill package, drawn mostly from Silvia Canelón’s Sharing Your Work with xaringan.
